result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:19 pm - Defendant Ryan Andrew King appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Julius Andriusis appeared by video for Ryan Andrew King.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
1) Michael Stone, Detective Sgt. Manitowoc City Police Department, is sworn and testifies for the State.
Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charges contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
BAIL MOTION-
Parties argue the motion.
The Court finds that any modifications in the bail at this stage would be inappropriate.  Motion is denied.
State to draft order.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
It is hereby ordered the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied for the reasons stated on the record on August 24, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail.
The petition for appointment of counsel is denied because the SPD appointed counsel between date of hearing an receipt of this paperwork.

records.addlTxt: Julius Andriusis through Public Defender

1:50 PM Defendant Ryan Andrew King appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. The public defender's office has yet to assign an attorney to this case.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits in which to conduct the preliminary examination.  Court informs the Defendant that he can apply for a court appointed attorney.  Defendant wishes to exercise this right.  Judge Dietz asks Attorney Michael Turner if he'd be interested in taking the case.  Attorney Turner will review the contents and get back to the Court.
Preliminary hearing is rescheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Seal Victim Impact Statements.

Zoom appearances.
The matter was set for preliminary hearing today.  Public defender has not appointed counsel yet.
The Court explains the difference between a public defender and court appointed counsel.  The defendant will wait for public defender to appoint.
The State has no objection to one more adjournments.  There is an active victim in this matter.
Court tolls the time period and finds good cause to do so.
Preliminary hearing is set for 08-10-22 at 1:30 p.m.

Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. false imprisonment and attempted 1st degree intentional homicide while armed.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-31-22 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with N.S.B., DOB: 12-03-1985 and J.S.G., DOB: 10-05-1962 and any premises those persons occupy, defendant is not to possess any weapons, and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and all controlled substances.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Minutes.

The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
